definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: This old pine has undergone extreme weather but still stands tall and straight.
sentences.chinese: 这棵百年老松历经了百年风雨依然树身劲拔。

sentences.english: Colsing him or her, you can see the scars above eight or nine in their bodies.
sentences.chinese: 走近细看，有的树身竟是八九个以上的疤痕。

sentences.english: When enough of the tree is chopped away, the tree falls.
sentences.chinese: 当树身被砍得够深时，树就倒了。

sentences.english: Tree crown come off tree trunk, what kind of pain will it be?
sentences.chinese: 树冠脱离了树身，那是什么样的疼痛？

sentences.english: Their roots bulked above the ground and the branches were twisted.
sentences.chinese: 地面盘根错节，树身枝干缠绕。

sentences.english: The further I cut into the belly of the tree, the more bees I found.
He gashed the tree with a saw.
The taproot grows straight down to anchor the tree and reach for deep water.
sentences.chinese: 主根垂直向下生长，以固定树身，并吸取深处的水分。

sentences.english: Sequoias fascinate people by their size and age.
sentences.chinese: 红杉魅力无穷，其树身之大，寿命之长，令人赞叹。

sentences.english: Dot them around the tree from top to bottom, spacing them out evenly.
sentences.chinese: 从树顶到底部围绕树身点缀，保持均匀的间隔。

definition: to wrap one's arm around (used to describe the girth of a tree trunk)
variant of 枝椏|枝桠[zhi1 ya1]
